intro: Xylopia lemurica, commonly known as the lemur's wood or sacred tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Xylopia lemurica is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
